title: 'Other countries have money too': Chinese businesses make threat
description: Economists continue to warn that U.S. President Donald Trump's steep new tariffs will cause prices to soar for a wide range of imported goods. Many building and construction materials, they warn, are imported from Canada — while a long list of fruits and vegetables enter in the United States from Mexico. A variety of products are manufactured in Mainland China, which may face some of the steepest tariffs of all. In an article published on April 30, the BBC's Linda Bicker reports that Mainland China is looking to beef up its relationships with other trading partners in response to Trump's...

title: Flying Robots Unlock New Horizons in Construction
description: An international team led by researchers from Empa and EPFL has explored how in future aerial robots could process construction materials precisely in the air - an approach with great potential for difficult-to-access locations or work at great heights.

title: Two charged with stolen farm equipment, firearm after police search in Oliver (Oliver/Osoyoos)
description: Two people have been arrested in connection with stolen property, including farming equipment and a firearm, following a police property search. On April 15, RCMP executed a warrant at a property on Road 15, finding two stolen motorcycles, stolen construction material, farming equipment, a firearm a...

title: PPS and USFK Acquisition Partners host Joint Industry Day in South Korea [Image 23 of 23]
description: Jean Ross and a Korean employee from Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Indo-Pacific speaks with a prospective contractor about partnering with the agency at Joint Industry Day, April 9, 2025, in Seoul, South Korea. title: JTF-Bravo completes PANAMAX-Alpha Phase 0 2025 [Image 8 of 10]
description: U.S. Army Sgt. Brian Vazquez, Joint Task Force-Bravo Headquarters Support Company sling load inspector, loads construction material into a HH-60 Blackhawk during PANAMAX-Alpha Phase 0 in Panama, March 29, 2025. The construction materials were donated to Guna Yala Comarca to support the building of a local school. (U.S. Air Force photo by Staff Sgt. Tristan Biese)

title: JTF-Bravo completes PANAMAX-Alpha Phase 0 2025 [Image 7 of 10]
description: A Joint Task Force-Bravo HH-60 Blackhawk carries construction material during PANAMAX-Alpha Phase 0 in Panama, March 29, 2025. PANAMAX-Alpha is a bilateral exercise between the United States and Panama conducted by JTF-Bravo and supported by the U.S. Southern Command. (Courtesy photo)

title: JTF-Bravo completes PANAMAX-Alpha Phase 0 2025 [Image 2 of 10]
description: U.S. Army Joint Task Force-Bravo Headquarters Support Company Soldiers hook up cargo containing construction material to a HH-60 Blackhawk during PANAMAX-Alpha Phase 0 in Panama, March 29, 2025. JTF-Bravo transported more than 1,000 lbs of construction materials provided by the Ministry of Education to Mamitupu. (U.S. Air Force photo by Staff Sgt. Tristan Biese)

title: Trump spares homebuilders on Canadian and Mexican imports, but China’s tariff hits hard
description: President Trump didn’t do homebuilders any favors by imposing a dramatic 54% tariff on China, a critical supplier of construction materials.

title: North Carolina DOT hurricane recovery to utilize national forest materials
description: Access to construction materials in the Pisgah National Forest has been granted, as North Carolina DOT hurricane recovery efforts continue.

title: Cyprus: Construction Material Prices Up 1.38% Annually in February 2025
description: FAMAGUSTA GAZETTE – The Price Index of Construction Materials rose by 1.38% in February 2025 compared to the same month last year, reaching 118.56 units (2021=100). Month-over-month, the index increased by 0.82%. Year-over-year, notable category increases included minerals (3.09%), mineral products (3.04%), electromechanical products (1.85%), and products of wood, insulation materials, chemicals, and plastics (0.84%). […]

title: Holcim Targets Up to 8% Annual Revenue Growth for US Spinoff
description: Holcim Ltd.’s soon-to-be spun-off US construction materials business Amrize said it will target revenue growth of between 5% and 8% a year through fiscal 2028 as it bets on rising building activity in North America.

title: Bass issues order to expedite rebuilding of more fire-resistant homes in LA
description: The order directs city departments to streamline permitting for homeowners who rebuild all-electric and more fire-resistant homes, promote the use of fire-resistant construction materials.

title: Construction costs in Cyprus climb as material prices increase in February
description: Cyprus’ Construction Materials Price Index for February 2025 recorded an annual increase of 1.38 per cent, according to the latest data from the Cyprus Statistical Service (Cystat). Meanwhile, prices for the first two months of the year rose by 0.94 per cent. In February, the index reached 118.56 units, with 2021 acting as the base […]

title: Need for expertise to maintain old buildings
description: (March 15): Sabah has a significant number of old reinforced concrete (RC) buildings, many of which were constructed decades ago. These buildings serve residential, commercial and public purposes, and require proper maintenance to ensure they remain safe, functional.and compliant with modern regulations. However, due to the tropical climate, environmental conditions, sub-standard construction material and material [...]The post Need for expertise to maintain old buildings appeared first on Borneo Post Online.

title: Fire-ravaged Alberta town of Jasper gets more aid from governments
description: JASPER, Alta. — The federal and Alberta governments are ushering in new support for Jasper as the mountain town continues to rebuild from last summer’s devastating wildfires. The federal government says $2 million will be spent on a pop-up village for 11 local businesses and a storage workspace for construction materials inside the town’s small […]

title: WINTRUP: Trade war will make housing even less affordable
description: A trade war between Canada and the United States will impede average people’s access to housing, accelerating the housing crisis for Winnipeggers already painfully suffering on the housing front. Canadian retaliatory tariffs of 25% applied to construction materials flowing north from the United States will drive up the hard construction costs of homebuilding. A compounding […]

title: County wants to buy land to improve emergency evacuation routes in Lahaina
description: A council committee backed the $1.7 million purchase of land that could be used in the short term to house volunteers helping with rebuilding and to store construction materials.

title: Price growth of building materials in Metro Manila slows in January
description: Price growth of construction materials in the National Capital Region (NCR) eased in January amid lower interest rates and a weaker peso, the Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA) reported on Friday. According to preliminary data, the January construction materials retail price index (CMRPI) slowed to 1.2% in January, from 1.5% recorded in December and 1.4% reported […]

title: Report: Hamas Wants To Continue Deal: “We’ll Release 3 Hostages On Shabbos”
description: Hamas is committed to continuing the hostage deal and intends to carry out the sixth hostage release on Shabbos and release another three hostages, according to a message on an official Hamas channel on Thursday morning. According to a report in the Saudi news outlet Al Asharq  Saudi news outlet, Hamas confirmed its commitment to the agreement to Egyptian officials. The report added that Hamas conditioned the step on Israel allowing the entry of trailers, tents, heavy equipment, fuel, medications and hospital construction materials into the Gaza Strip. title: World’s first Low Carbon Ratings system for Cement and Concrete launches
description: Global system aims to incentivise procurement of more sustainable building materials System will provide transparency and trust, and help governments and businesses identify and buy more sustainable cement and concrete, the world’s most used substance after water LONDON — The Global Cement and Concrete Association (GCCA) announces the launch of Low Carbon Ratings (LCR) […]

title: Sustainable building material extracted from seawater
description: A sand-like material can be extracted from seawater by adding carbon dioxide, potentially making the building industry more sustainable.The post Sustainable building material extracted from seawater appeared first on Advanced Science News.

title: Temporary Debris Staging and Reduction Site - Temescal Canyon Road, Palisades [Image 22 of 23]
description: Temescal Canyon Road is playing a key role in wildfire recovery by recycling concrete and debris while it is being used as a Temporary Debris Staging and Reduction site in Pacific Palisades, California, March 28, 2025.The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, in collaboration with federal, state, and local partners, is working safely and quickly to remove wildfire ash and debris from nearly 13,600 homes, paving the way for community rebuilding efforts. (U.S. Army Corps of Engineers photo by Christopher Rosario)

title: Artificial reef construction resumes at Carolina Beach State Park
description: NC Marine Fisheries and NC Coastal Federation are collaborating to move more than 2,100 tons of recycled concrete to build an artificial reef.
